title: Solved One Issue Another Arise, Please Halp
body:
I have posted about an issue before but it has been resolved. Now the problem is that my computer will freeze and restart. Plus, the patch time for league of legends is over 700 minutes long. I have good internet and my brothers do not struggle with their patch times. I do not use wifi. It usually gets a portion of the way done and either bug splat or freezes. What can be causing this? I replaced the mobo recently to fix other issues I had but now I have this one.

  Specs:
1. windows 10
2. i5-7600k
3. evga 1060 sc
4. evga ddr4 2400 2x8gb
5. evga 650w supernova gold plus
6. asus tuf z270 mark 2 mobo
7. 1tb 7200rpm WD Black Hdd
8. cooler master evo 212
9. 2x120mm exhaust fans
10. 2x140mm intake fans

I believe it is my psu or HDD, but I do not know much about computers so. My ram past the windows mem test. I really do not know how to test my psu. It even freezes up on internet explorer sometimes. I disabled gpu and it still does the same . 

What causes these super slow/long patch times and all the bug splats?

replies.body:
If your pc is freezing up on only IE sometimes this might not be related to League overall, but let's take a crack at it. This *could* be some kind of weird sign of packet loss or something blocking your connection from getting a stable link with the servers.

I'd like you to run a traceroute to our NA servers to check for packet loss first. Run a trace to 104.160.131.1 for about 5-10 min and post those results here so I can take a look. Please be sure to block out the top line as well!
